isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION, SINGLE DRIVE AXLES: EATON - WHEEL DIFFERENTIAL LOCK - INSTALLATION AND ASSEMBLY

svcsubproc.title: Differential Lock

note.para: With differential carrier completely assembled and adjusted, install differential lock as follows:

step1.para: Install the fixed curvic clutch on the splined hub of the flanged differential case, then install the snap ring ( Figure 64and Figure 65).

If the shift fork and sliding curvic clutch are disassembled, engage fork with clutch hub and install spring pin in end of fork long leg to hold components together. Refer to Figure 66 for fork mounting position on clutch. Install bolt in the fork and tighten finger-tight.
Place compression spring and switch actuator in shift box ( Figure 67).

figure.caption: Figure 67. Place Compression Spring and Switch Actuator in Shift Box

step1.para: Position the shift fork and clutch assembly on the carrier, inserting fork head in shift box on top of actuator. Install push rod, engaging fork head, switch actuator, compression spring and pilot hole in carrier ( Figure 68).

figure.caption: Figure 68. Position Shift Fork and Clutch Assembly on Carrier

note.para: The shift cylinder is serviced only as an assembly. However, if the cylinder was disassembled and parts are serviceable, assemble as described in steps 5 through 8.

step1.para: Install new O-ring on piston ( Figure 69).

figure.caption: Figure 69. Install Piston Assembly in Cylinder

step1.para: Lubricate piston and O-ring with silicone grease and install piston assembly in cylinder. Position piston with small diameter hub toward closed end of cylinder ( Figure 69).
Install seal on cylinder, piloting seal shoulder inside cylinder ( Figure 69).
Install mounting bracket on cylinder ( Figure 69).

Place shift cylinder assembly on end of push rod ( Figure 70). Compress cylinder assembly by hand to keep push rod piloted in carrier, and install mounting bracket bolts. Tighten to 28 to 35 ft-lbs. (38 to 47 N•m).

note.para: At this stage of assembly, adjust shift fork position.

step1.para: With clutches disengaged, adjust position of shift fork on push rod to set a clearance of 0.120 inch (3 mm) between the clutch teeth ( Figure 71).

Adjust as follows: place two 0.120 inch (3 mm) feeler gauges (one on each side of the clutches) between the tips of the clutch teeth ( Figure 71). Slide shift fork on push rod to set clutch clearance. Working through carrier pipe plug opening, tighten shift fork bolt to 12 to 15 ft-lbs. (16 to 20 N•m).
Check differential lock clutch engagement by one of two following methods:

svcsubproc.para: Apply air pressure (80 to 120 psi) to shift cylinder port to engage clutches ( Figure 53).
Install an M12x1.5 bolt, over 1.5 inches (38 mm) long, in the cylinder air port to manually engage clutches ( Figure 54).

note.para: Hand tighten the bolt. Over-tightening may cause damage to the shift unit. To facilitate hand tightening, lubricate bolt threads with axle lube.

step1.para: Correct Fork Adjustment. Fork adjustment is correct when clutch curvic teeth are fully engaged with the fork free when moved by hand ( Figure 72). When air pressure is released or manual bolt is removed, the shift assembly should disengage freely.
Recheck the 0.120 inch (3 mm) clutch teeth clearance with shift cylinder fully disengaged. If not correct, readjust fork position (see steps 1 and 2).
With differential lock correctly adjusted, coat pipe plug with sealant and install plug in carrier shift box.
Install selector switch and plastic washer in carrier shift box. Tighten switch to 10 to 12 ft-lbs. (14 to 16 N•m).

Check Selector Switch Operation. Check switch electrically with an ohmmeter or continuity tester. Switch should close (show continuity) when clutches are engaged and should open (no continuity) when clutches are disengaged.

svcsubproc.title: Differential Carrier Assembly in Axle Housing

step1.para: The differential lock must be engaged and held in the engaged position to facilitate installation of carrier assembly in axle housing. This can be accomplished by one of two methods:

svcsubproc.para: Use an auxiliary air line and apply air pressure (80 to 120 psi) to shift cylinder port to engage clutch ( Figure 53).
Install an M12x1.5 bolt, over 1.5 inches (38 mm) long, in the cylinder air port to manually engage clutches ( Figure 54).

note.para: Hand tighten the bolt. Over-tightening may cause damage to the shift unit. To facilitate hand tightening, lubricate bolt threads with axle lube.

step1.para: Complete the installation of the carrier following instructions for your specific axle.

important.para: When installing axle shafts, make sure the double splined shaft is installed in the shift unit side of the differential carrier.

step1.para: After carrier installation, disconnect auxiliary air line or remove bolt from cylinder air port. Connect vehicle air supply to shift cylinder and electrical lead wires to selector switch.
Check differential lock operation from driver's cab before releasing vehicle for service.
